perturbation.original_text: (A) Information Exchange. Within forty-five (45) days after the Effective Date, Seller shall provide (I) to the Purchaser, an updated list of all Patents (other than those set forth on Schedule 1.1(l) of the Seller IPA Disclosure Schedule) owned by any Seller Party that (x) have an effective filing date or are based on an invention disclosure having a date of disclosure that is on or after January 9, 2007, and (y) that name as inventors, in Seller's reasonable, good-faith belief, one or more Business Employees and one or more Persons that are not Business Employees (the "Patent Review List"), and (II) to the Invention Disclosure Review Team, a list of invention disclosures (other than those set forth on Schedule 1.1(l) of the Seller IPA Disclosure Schedule or Schedule 1.1(j)) owned by any Seller Party that name as contributors one or more Business Employees
perturbation.changed_text: (A) Information Exchange. Within ten (10) days after the Effective Date, Seller shall provide (I) to the Purchaser, an updated list of all Patents (other than those set forth on Schedule 1.1(l) of the Seller IPA Disclosure Schedule) owned by any Seller Party that (x) have an effective filing date or are based on an invention disclosure having a date of disclosure that is on or after January 9, 2007, and (y) that name as inventors, in Seller's reasonable, good-faith belief, one or more Business Employees and one or more Persons that are not Business Employees (the "Patent Review List"), and (II) to the Invention Disclosure Review Team, a list of invention disclosures (other than those set forth on Schedule 1.1(l) of the Seller IPA Disclosure Schedule or Schedule 1.1(j)) owned by any Seller Party that name as contributors one or more Business Employees
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the timeframe for providing the patent list to 10 days may be insufficient under legal standards of 'reasonable time' for delivering complex information, potentially contradicting requirements for adequate disclosure.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Requirements for 'reasonable time' in information disclosure

perturbation.original_text: During the Review Period, within seventy-five (75) days after the Effective Date (or, in the event of any repeat of the process set forth in this Section 2.1(b)(iii)(C) in accordance with Section 2.1(b)(iii)(D), promptly (and no later than seventy-five (75) days) thereafter), Seller shall cause (on and prior to the Initial Closing Date), or the parties shall each cause (following the Initial Closing Date), as applicable, their respective employees on the Invention Disclosure Review Team to: (I) promptly review the Invention Disclosure Review List; (II) in good-faith determine whether any of the invention disclosures (and inventions listed on the Invention Disclosure Review List (and inventions described therein))
perturbation.changed_text: During the Review Period, within fifteen (15) days after the Effective Date (or, in the event of any repeat of the process set forth in this Section 2.1(b)(iii)(C) in accordance with Section 2.1(b)(iii)(D), promptly (and no later than fifteen (15) days) thereafter), Seller shall cause (on and prior to the Initial Closing Date), or the parties shall each cause (following the Initial Closing Date), as applicable, their respective employees on the Invention Disclosure Review Team to: (I) promptly review the Invention Disclosure Review List; (II) in good-faith determine whether any of the invention disclosures (and inventions listed on the Invention Disclosure Review List (and inventions described therein))
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the invention disclosure review period to 15 days is likely insufficient for a thorough review, conflicting with the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing present in contract law, which requires reasonable time for fulfilling contractual obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing in Contract Law

perturbation.original_text: If such senior-levels of executives cannot resolve the dispute with respect to any such Patents (the "Outstanding Patents") by the Initial Closing Date, then either party may, within thirty (30) days after the Initial Closing Date,
perturbation.changed_text: If such senior-levels of executives cannot resolve the dispute with respect to any such Patents (the "Outstanding Patents") by the Initial Closing Date, then either party may, within five (5) days after the Initial Closing Date,
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time frame to submit the 'Outstanding Patents' for dispute resolution to 5 days, contradicting the regulations and legal precedents on providing a reasonable timeframe for settling disputes. This creates non-compliance with regulatory standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Reasonable timeframe to settle disputes
